intro: Erysimum dentatum, commonly known as the toothed wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features bright yellow flowers with four petals. Its leaves are alternate and have a distinctive toothed or serrated edge, contributing to its common name. Erysimum dentatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
